slides.title: Welcome to CIMA P1
slides.content:
# P1 - Management Accounting

P1 covers **costing**, **planning**, and **decision making**.

## What You Will Learn

- **Costing** - Methods and systems
- **Planning** - Budgeting
- **Decision Making** - Techniques
- **Control** - Performance

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Cost management | 30% |
| Budgeting | 25% |
| Decision making | 25% |
| Control | 20% |

slides.title: Activity-Based Costing
slides.content:
# ABC Method

## Process

```
1. Identify activities
2. Create cost pools
3. Identify cost drivers
4. Calculate rates
5. Apply to products
```

## Traditional vs ABC

| Traditional | ABC |
|-------------|-----|
| Volume-based | Activity-based |
| Single rate | Multiple pools |
| Simpler | More accurate |

## When to Use ABC

- High overheads
- Product diversity
- Competition

slides.title: Target Costing
slides.content:
# Market-Driven Costing

## Formula

```
Target Cost = Market Price - Required Profit
```

## Process

```
1. Market research
2. Set target price
3. Determine profit margin
4. Calculate target cost
5. Design to cost
```

## Cost Reduction

| Technique | Approach |
|-----------|----------|
| Value engineering | Design stage |
| Value analysis | Production |
| Kaizen | Continuous |

slides.title: Costing Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Target cost equals market price minus?

slides.title: Life Cycle Costing
slides.content:
# Full Product Cost

## Stages

```
Development -> Introduction -> Growth -> Maturity -> Decline
```

## Costs Per Stage

| Stage | Focus |
|-------|-------|
| Development | R&D |
| Introduction | Marketing |
| Growth | Production |
| Maturity | Efficiency |
| Decline | Exit |

## Benefit

- Total cost visibility
- Better pricing decisions
- Environmental costs

slides.title: Throughput Accounting
slides.content:
# Theory of Constraints

## Key Measures

```
Throughput = Sales - Material Cost

Return per Factory Hour = Throughput / Time on Bottleneck

Throughput Ratio = Return / Cost per Hour
```

## Ranking

| Ratio | Decision |
|-------|----------|
| > 1 | Profitable |
| = 1 | Break-even |
| < 1 | Unprofitable |

## Bottleneck Focus

Maximize throughput at constraint.

slides.title: Budgeting Methods
slides.content:
# Budget Types

## Approaches

| Type | Method |
|------|--------|
| Incremental | Prior + change |
| Zero-based | From scratch |
| Rolling | Continuous |
| Activity-based | Activities |

## Behavioral Aspects

| Issue | Impact |
|-------|--------|
| Participation | Motivation |
| Budget slack | Padding |
| Dysfunctional | Gaming |

slides.title: Variance Analysis
slides.content:
# Advanced Variances

## Material Variances

```
Price: (AP - SP) x AQ
Usage: (AQ - SQ) x SP
Mix: (AM - SM) x SP
Yield: (AY - SY) x SC
```

## Sales Variances

```
Price: (AP - SP) x AQ
Volume: (AQ - SQ) x SP or SC
Mix: (AM - SM) x Contribution
Quantity: (AQ - SQ) x WAC
```

slides.title: Decision Making
slides.content:
# Short-Term Decisions

## Relevant Costing

| Relevant | Irrelevant |
|----------|------------|
| Future | Sunk |
| Incremental | Committed |
| Cash flow | Non-cash |

## Decision Types

| Decision | Key Factor |
|----------|------------|
| Make or buy | Incremental |
| Special order | Contribution |
| Shutdown | Avoidable costs |
| Limiting factor | Contribution/unit |

slides.title: Limiting Factors
slides.content:
# Scarce Resources

## Single Factor

```
Contribution per Unit of Limiting Factor

Rank products and allocate
```

## Multiple Factors

```
Linear programming:

Maximize C = aX + bY
Subject to constraints
```

## Shadow Price

```
Value of one more unit of
scarce resource
```

slides.title: Pricing Decisions
slides.content:
# Pricing Strategies

## Cost-Based

| Method | Formula |
|--------|--------|
| Full cost-plus | Total cost + margin |
| Marginal | Variable + margin |

## Market-Based

| Strategy | Approach |
|----------|----------|
| Penetration | Low initial |
| Skimming | High initial |
| Competitive | Match market |
| Premium | Above market |

slides.title: Risk and Uncertainty
slides.content:
# Dealing with Risk

## Techniques

| Technique | Method |
|-----------|--------|
| Expected value | Probability weighted |
| Sensitivity | Change one variable |
| Simulation | Multiple scenarios |
| Decision trees | Mapped outcomes |

## Expected Value

```
EV = Sum of (Probability x Outcome)
```

## Risk Attitude

- Risk-averse
- Risk-neutral
- Risk-seeking

slides.title: Performance Measurement
slides.content:
# Measuring Performance

## Responsibility Centers

| Type | Accountable For |
|------|----------------|
| Cost | Costs |
| Revenue | Revenue |
| Profit | Both |
| Investment | Return on assets |

## Investment Center

```
ROI = Profit / Capital Employed

RI = Profit - (Capital x Cost)
```
